page.title: 09EBNAL HALL FARM, GOBOWEN
page.content: Mr Jones of Ebnal is helped by a full time worker and one part timer. {86 milking cows}form a herd with one Hereford bull. Young bulls are sold at Oswetry market whilst heiffers are reared to join the herd. Out of{196 {acres,}60 are under{barley}for winter feed,1 acre is{potatoes}and the rest is grass for grazing or{silage. The cows are milked twice a day, milk is collected by bulk tanker and taken to a dairy at Ruyton X1 Towns. A daily average of 1,300 litres of milk is produced. In a large barn four tractors, combine and forage harvesters and a baler are stored. The family have two horses, chickens, dog and cats for pets. In his spare time the{farmer makes model aeroplanes and goes water ski-ing.
